title: Leoš Janáček
summary: Leoš Janáček (Czech: [ˈlɛoʃ ˈjanaːtʃɛk] (listen),[1] baptised Leo Eugen Janáček; 3 July 1854 – 12 August 1928) was a Czech composer, musical theorist, folklorist, publicist and teacher. He was inspired by Moravian and other Slavic, including Eastern European folk music to create an original, modern musical style.[2]
